metadata.Title: CVE-2020-7020 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: Elasticsearch versions before 6.8.13 and 7.9.2 contain a document disclosure flaw when Document or Field Level Security is used. Search queries do not properly preserve security permissions when executing certain complex queries. This could result in the search disclosing the existence of documents the attacker should not be able to view. This could result in an attacker gaining additional insight into potentially sensitive indices.

criterions.comment: elasticsearch: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
